page.title: 01LOCH BROOM,ULLAPOOL.
page.content: This area is dominated by Loch Broom,a glaciated valley,with mountains rising on either side. Ullapool Pier,south of the village,has plans for further extensions, due to the enormous catches of mackerel over recent years. Caledonian MacBrayne's passenger and vehicular ferry docks at the pier. A small ferry sails between the pier and Altnaharrie,an inn on the opposite side of the loch. Ullapool Point has a thriving camping and caravan site also a static caravan site is at Corry Point. On the road south of Ullapool,there are several hotels,guest-houses and a housing development on Braes. On the south shore of Loch Broom there are remains of a fort and broch and nearby,are the off-shore pens of a salmon farm.
